channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Lisa Shaw: Presenter's death due to complications of Covid vaccine
item.description: Lisa Shaw developed headaches shortly after being vaccinated against Covid-19, an inquest hears.

item.title: Afghanistan: Operation Arc Luton evacuation plane is swapped
item.description: A plane from a country closer to Kabul will collect Paul "Pen" Farthing along with his animals.

item.title: Further arrests after Birmingham Gay Village attack
item.description: A 24-year-old and 21-year-old are arrested on suspicion of robbery and wounding, police say.

item.title: 'Shocking' Hull A63 crossing attempt caught on CCTV
item.description: Footage shows the man squeezing through the central reservation as traffic passes just feet away.

item.title: Ingoldmells caravan fire: Girl who died named by family and friends
item.description: The two-year-old was with her mum and three siblings when fire broke out in the static home.

item.title: Lee Peacock: Westminster murders suspect found with critical injuries
item.description: Police were searching for 49-year-old Lee Peacock in connection with the deaths of two people in Westminster.

item.title: Ted Dexter: Former England and Sussex captain dies aged 86
item.description: Former England captain and attacking batter Ted Dexter dies aged 86.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand attends court as fan denies racist abuse
item.description: Jamie Arnold is set to stand trial next year accused of racially abusing the ex-England footballer.

item.title: Fulham supermarkets targeted by man with syringes
item.description: People who bought food at three west London shops are being told to throw it away.

item.title: Woman found dead in Oxfordshire lake identified after CCTV appeal
item.description: The woman was caught on CCTV eight days before her body was found in Cresswell Lake, Oxfordshire.

item.title: Shopkeeper gets suspended jail term for giving girls cigarettes for kisses
item.description: A judge says Fozlu Raman is "a disgrace" to his family for grooming the girls but does not jail him.

item.title: Derriford hospital bed shortage declared 'critical incident'
item.description: Derriford Hospital in Plymouth is operating at 97% bed capacity amid a rise in Covid cases.

item.title: Paralympics: Family joy at Dame Sarah Storey's 15th gold
item.description: Barney Storey says watching his wife win her 15th Paralympic gold medal from home was "surreal".

item.title: Blackpool man has Lake District tattoo so he 'can always see the fells'
item.description: A man from Blackpool has had the outline of a view of the Lake District fells tattooed on his arm.

item.title: DJ to hold Ministry of Sound fundraiser for twin brother in Covid coma
item.description: The twin of a DJ who fell into a coma after catching Covid is holding a club night to raise money for his care.

item.title: Hybrid electric plane takes first flight in England
item.description: Electric planes are "the future" and could revive local airports, industry experts suggest.

item.title: 'Marmite' Snake Pass road marks 200 years
item.description: While many enjoy its picturesque surroundings, in bad weather the route can see motorists stranded.

item.title: Simon Dobbin: Cambridge United fan died from brain injury complications
item.description: Simon Dobbin was brain damaged after being attacked following a match and died five years later.

item.title: Man treated after accidentally making chlorine gas
item.description: He mixed bleach and lime scale remover and inadvertently made a toxic gas and was taken to hospital.

item.title: Isle of Man: Cargo ship runs aground near Cranstal
item.description: The island's coastguard tries to free a cargo vessel that ran aground near Cranstal overnight.

item.title: Counsellor to help with quarry stench depression
item.description: A doctor supporting the new role says odour from a landfill site "really is getting people down".

item.title: Idles repay Bristol venue with two intimate shows
item.description: Idles return to the Bristol venue that supported them in their early days for two intimate gigs.

item.title: World Cup qualifiers: Bamford gets first England call-up as Alexander-Arnold returns
item.description: Leeds United striker Patrick Bamford has received his first senior call-up for England's 2022 World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: Manchester City: Pep Guardiola says he will leave club when his contract expires in 2023
item.description: Pep Guardiola says he will leave Manchester City when his contract runs out in 2023 before managing a national team.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Lee Pearson wins 12th gold as GB enjoy cycling and swimming success
item.description: Lee Pearson wins his 12th gold medal as Great Britain enjoy a successful day two at the Tokyo Paralympics
